Cargo

Inside Aerojet: The Essential Services That Keep Cargo Aviation Running 24/7

2025-02-15 · 6 min read · Aerojet Editorial Team · Costa Rica, Central America

Air cargo never sleeps — and neither does Aerojet. Behind each flight, there is a coordinated network of ramp agents, logistics specialists, dispatchers, and technical teams ensuring that every shipment arrives safely and on time. This is a look inside the 24/7 ecosystem that powers regional and international cargo aviation operations.

24/7 Ramp Operations: Where Every Minute Counts

Cargo aircraft operate on extremely tight schedules, and any delay can disrupt global supply chains. Aerojet’s ramp teams work around the clock to ensure fast, safe, and precise aircraft turnarounds.

From marshalling and parking to loading, unloading, and ULD control, every movement is executed with strict adherence to IATA and ICAO standards. Specialized GSE such as electric loaders, towbarless tractors, and GPU/ASU units ensure efficiency while supporting sustainable operations.

Safety supervisors oversee each process, guaranteeing flawless coordination even during peak hours or night operations.

Documentation, Customs & Compliance Without Delays

Cargo aviation depends on impeccable documentation and regulatory precision. Aerojet assists airlines and freight operators with airway bills, manifests, import/export documentation, and customs interactions.

The goal is simple: zero delays, zero compliance risks. Teams monitor all documentation in real time and maintain constant communication with customs, health authorities, and security units.

Whether it's perishables, pharma, or DG cargo, documentation accuracy is key to safe and compliant handling.

Technical Support & Fueling: Keeping Aircraft Ready to Fly

Aerojet provides on-ground technical support, from minor line maintenance to AOG assistance. FAA-certified technicians handle inspections, troubleshooting, and system checks to minimize downtime.

Fueling supervision ensures quality, safety, and transparency — especially for late-night operations where precision is critical to avoiding route or schedule disruptions.

  • Jet A-1 fueling coordination
  • Line maintenance and AOG support
  • Oil, nitrogen, and oxygen servicing
  • Technical interventions via trusted MRO partners

Security & AVSEC: Protecting Every Shipment

Aviation security is a non-negotiable part of cargo operations. Aerojet’s AVSEC teams work closely with airport authorities to implement screening, preventive security checks, documentation verification, and continuous monitoring of sensitive shipments.

This rigorous approach ensures full alignment with national and international aviation regulations — safeguarding people, assets, and the integrity of the cargo supply chain.

Logistics Support: Connecting Central America to the World

Aerojet’s regional presence enables seamless cargo coordination across Costa Rica, Honduras, El Salvador, Guatemala, and Panama.

This interconnected network supports express shipments, perishables, e-commerce, and multi-stop cargo missions requiring precise time management and special handling.

With a 24/7 operations desk, airlines receive continuous updates, pre-alert confirmations, and real-time support for every stage of the flight.
